entry.title: Re: Hi Experts,
entry.content:
Hi @pavani042 

Thank you for your message. Let me walk you through it.

Regarding your question about splitting one existing company into seven companies in SAP HCM. Here are the options that are available to you.

You can model the common company as the root organization with the six individual companies as sub-nodes beneath it. This setup supports your shared organizational elements and ensures you have a centralized control.

There is no standard paste function to duplicate departments or organizational units. To replicate the departments and structure under the new companies, you will need to either manually recreate them using SAP OM tools or use custom programs or migration tools like LSMW to copy and adjust the organizational units.

Please note, after copying, it is important to update the parent-child relationships and validate the organizational consistency with SAP reports.

In your case, large restructures like this often benefit from technical support to automate copying and ensure accuracy.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Prevent workflows from being approved after a certain date
entry.content:
Hi,

We use workflow approvals to manage time-off.
We currently have a rule to prevent submission before a certain date (Using Rules attached to the time type).

Problem is, managers are approving workflows for days requested in the past, where payroll for that period already closed.

For example, say you want a week off from September 1st until September 7th.  That payroll period is currently open...
So they will be able to submit the time-off and create the workflow just fine.

The problem comes when a manager approves this but it's too late.... for example, If the manager approves this on September 2nd, this will be late for payroll, as on September 2nd, the pay period is already closed.

Is there any way to prevent a Workflow from being approved after a certain date?

entry.title: XML Transformation using FM for Deep Nested Structure
entry.content:
In Integration projects many times we get a requirement to parse the XML file into ABAP structures. For deeply nested XML it is recommended to use XSLT transaction for performance.

Though the XSLT is much faster than using the FM but the drawback here is it’s not easy to step inside transformation to debug and find the mapping issue.

Hope this blog will be helpful for those who are looking for parsing and transforming the deep nested XML with FM “SMUM_XML_PARSE”. 

Sample XML structure is as shown below                                                    

As per the above images, we can see that STOP_SEG, SHIPMENT_SEG, SHIPMENT_ORDER, SHIPMENT_LINE_SEG & LOAD_DETAIL_SEG are repetitive.

Declare the Structure and Table type in DDIC as per the XML tag fields to create deep nested table

Read XML file data from AL11 into internal table

Concatenate the file data into single string, convert string to XSTRING and pass it to FM “SMUM_XML_PARSE”

The data in GT_XMLTAB will be in the format as shown below

Loop the gt_xmltab to map the XML tags into ABAP structure

The deep nested structure GS_DATA will have output as shown below

Append it to Deep nested Internal table

Normalizing the GT_DATA table to store that data into DB table for further processing, the code is as shown below

The GT_NORM output will be as shown below

Only the corresponding LOAD_DETAIL_SEG are mapped 

Hope this blog is helpful to new joiners and who has similar requirement saving his/her dev time.  

Please leave comment for any suggestions or improvements.

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
With the 2508 release, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition continues to embed Artificial Intelligence (AI) at the core of business processes, enabling organizations to work smarter, faster, and with greater confidence. This release brings new AI-assisted capabilities across finance, service, and user experience, empowering employees to make data-driven decisions, reduce manual effort, and focus on higher-value tasks. By combining embedded AI, generative AI, and SAP’s digital assistant Joule, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 sets a new benchmark for intelligent ERP — helping businesses unlock efficiency, innovation, and resilience in the cloud.

 1. Joule Copilots

1.1. Joule for Business

In today's fast-moving digital landscape, businesses need solutions that simplify processes and enhance efficiency. SAP’s Joule for Business stands at the forefront of this transformation. By embedding artificial intelligence directly into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Joule for Business acts as a digital assistant that helps users navigate complex tasks through natural language interaction. With its intuitive design and AI-driven functionality, Joule is not just an assistant—it’s a strategic partner for every business user.

Simplifying Service Contract Management with Joule for Business

For Customer Service Managers, Joule for Business is a game-changer. It allows managers to express their business needs using everyday language, eliminating the need for specialized technical knowledge. Joule then guides users directly to key service management applications, such as the Manage Service Contracts app, Service Management Overview, and Service Contracts Dashboard. The result? Users experience faster navigation, enhanced satisfaction, and improved operational efficiency. By providing seamless access to apps like Mass Processing of Service Contracts and Monitor Auto Renewal Logs, Joule ensures that service contract management becomes a streamlined and user-friendly process.

Streamlining Solution Order Management

Joule for Business also empowers Solution Order Specialists to work more effectively. By understanding business requirements expressed in natural language, Joule navigates users directly to relevant solution order management applications. Key apps such as Solution Orders Overview and Solution Order Profitability are now just a simple command away. This not only saves time but also allows specialists to focus on core activities, driving productivity and enhancing decision-making. Joule thus bridges the gap between user intent and system functionality, transforming solution order management into a more accessible and efficient workflow.

AI-Assisted Sales Order Status Check

Beyond navigation, Joule for Business delivers tangible value in sales operations. With its AI-powered sales order status check, Joule enables businesses to monitor whether sales orders are on track and identify any issues hindering fulfillment. By translating complex fulfillment statuses into plain language, Joule helps users quickly understand bottlenecks, view potential causes, receive resolution suggestions, and seamlessly navigate to the appropriate applications. This functionality improves efficiency and accelerates issue resolution, ensuring that sales processes remain agile and customer-centric.

Read more about Joule: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant.html

 

1.2. Joule for Consultants

Joule for consultants is a conversational AI assistant designed to accelerate SAP project delivery. It achieves this by providing instant guidance grounded in an unmatched knowledge base that is exclusive to SAP and expertly curated. This foundation includes over 200,000 pages of documentation, SAP Notes, Knowledge Base Articles, and terabytes of content from SAP Communities. By tapping into this authoritative source, consultants can get fast, specific answers to complex questions, supporting every phase of a project from discover to run and saving up to 1.5 hours per day.

Beyond its extensive knowledge base, Joule offers powerful SAP-specific code intelligence, built upon a fine-tuned model trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code. This enables consultants to generate code from natural language prompts and significantly reduce the time needed to interpret unfamiliar code by up to 40%. The combination of expert guidance and advanced coding assistance directly impacts project timelines. This acceleration can shorten a typical 12-to-18-month project by up to 14%, translating to a reduction of 1.5 to 2.5 months in the overall project cycle

Read more about Joule for Consultants: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html

 

 1.3. Joule for Developers

Joule for developers is a generative AI assistant embedded within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity and accelerate the software development lifecycle. Its primary goal is to help developers write, test, and deliver optimized, bug-free code in ABAP Cloud in the shortest possible time. For developers working in environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this translates into a significant reduction in the time and effort required for both writing and testing code, leading to a faster realization of value from their development work.

The assistant provides several key capabilities to achieve this. It offers predictive code completion to generate ABAP code directly in the editor and a Joule chat feature for getting support on development questions using natural language. It can also explain existing development objects or selected lines of code to improve comprehension. To enhance quality, Joule assists in generating and improving ABAP unit tests and can create test classes specifically for CDS entities, helping ensure robust and reliable applications.

 

2. General Availability of AI-assisted Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

2.1. Simplify Asset Accounting with SAP Business AI and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In the Finance domain, we're enhancing the user experience with AI-powered innovations that transform the way fixed asset data is interpreted and managed. One of the standout features of this release is the introduction of AI-generated explanations for fixed asset key figures. These insights are delivered in natural language and help users clearly understand the origins and calculations behind critical values such as depreciation and net book value. This capability simplifies interpretation, allowing users to grasp financial figures and value changes more quickly, enhancing productivity and reducing the time needed for recurring financial tasks.

Additionally, this innovation comes with AI-assisted asset master data creation, enabling users to enter data using simple conversational commands. This approach decreases the effort and time required for data entry and onboarding while improving accuracy and data governance through intuitive, user-friendly interfaces. SAP Business AI is central to these enhancements, providing detailed explanations and support that facilitate better decision-making and enhance user satisfaction. This release reaffirms SAP's commitment to delivering efficient and user-centric solutions in asset accounting.

 

2.2. Group Reporting: AI-assisted Financial Business Insights for Group Financial Statements Review Booklet

Building on the successful beta release in 2502, predefined AI-assisted business insights—also known as quick actions—are now generally available in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet. These insights help streamline financial review processes by highlighting key figures, variances, and relevant context in natural language.

The Group Financial Statements Review Booklet, Cost Centers Review Booklet, and Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services now all include AI-powered business insights that enable faster analysis and easier interpretation of financial data. By reducing manual analysis effort and surfacing relevant context automatically, these booklets drive efficiency across various reporting tasks.

 

2.3. AI-assisted processing of incoming quality certificates with SAP Document AI

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we are excited to introduce SAP Document AI, a groundbreaking innovation that integrates generative AI into quality management processes. This advanced AI feature revolutionizes the handling of incoming quality certificates, significantly enhancing operational efficiency for our customers. By automating the extraction of relevant information from both paper and digital documents and incorporating it into SAP workflows, SAP Document AI streamlines the processing of supplier quality certificates. This leads to substantial reductions in manual efforts, faster processing times, and minimized human errors. As a result, quality technicians are liberated from monotonous tasks, enabling them to concentrate on more strategic and value-adding activities, which, in turn, helps companies expedite stock releases, minimize inspection-related production delays, and enhance overall throughput.

Moreover, SAP Document AI enhances accuracy and reliability by automatically matching quality certificates with system records and updating their status, ensuring that no document is misplaced and compliance is consistently maintained. Additionally, intelligent error handling fortifies system resilience and trust. One of the most compelling features of this solution is its seamless integration into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud experience, offered as a ready-to-use capability that requires no custom development, thereby providing customers with immediate value and swift ROI. As we continue to incorporate AI, data, and automation into our ERP offerings, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition serves as a cornerstone for smarter, more agile operations. The introduction of SAP Document AI exemplifies our commitment to supporting customers in future-proofing their business, driving continuous improvement, and fostering innovation.

 

2.4. Unlock seamless data access with AI-assisted easy enterprise search 

Accessing business data is now even more intuitive with the AI-assisted easy enterprise search, which allows users to search using natural language. Instead of navigating through complex structures, a simple query like “Show me sales orders overall status in process” or “Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR” provides relevant results instantly.

The system adapts the search results based on the user’s role, ensuring that only the most relevant business objects are presented. This not only improves search accuracy but also accelerates insight extraction—making it easier to act quickly and confidently in a data-rich environment. To enable this feature, select the 'enable AI natural language search' checkbox in the user profile settings.

 

3. Beta Programs of New AI-assisted Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

3.1. AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release brings a new dimension of intelligence to the user experience with the introduction of the AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home. Currently available in beta testing, this innovative feature simplifies the resolution of business-critical situations by dynamically guiding users through resolution steps—directly from the homepage.

This smart solution leverages generative AI to adapt the user interface in real time, presenting timely insights and suggested actions tailored to the specific business context. Designed to support fast, informed decisions, it transforms traditionally manual and multi-step tasks into a seamless, click-efficient experience.

Accessible from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud homepage, the solution enables situation handling in just a few clicks—significantly reducing the time and effort required to take action. Instead of navigating through multiple screens, users are presented with dynamic cards that surface key information and associated actions. These cards act as entry points to resolve issues directly, eliminating the need for in-depth navigation and enhancing day-to-day productivity.

The substantial benefits of this innovation include saving time, reducing complexity, and improving the quality of decision-making. Generative AI delivers context-aware recommendations and outcomes that are both trustworthy and relevant—built on enterprise-grade intelligence. This intuitive approach allows users to act confidently with minimal effort, ultimately boosting overall efficiency across key operational processes.

To illustrate its impact, consider a common example: a sales representative receives a notification that a sales quotation is about to expire. In a conventional workflow, the user would open the situation, navigate to the quotation, manually edit the details, save the changes, and then return to resolve the situation. With the AI-assisted solution in My Home, these steps are consolidated into a single, streamlined flow—demonstrating how user effort is minimized while responsiveness is maximized.

Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. For more details, visit the Get Involved Early page to register and contribute to the evolving landscape of AI-driven business processes. 

 

3.2. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications 

Personalizing the My Home workspace becomes faster and smarter with the new AI-assisted smart personalization feature. Currently in beta testing, it allows users to tailor their applications and insight tiles using natural language.

Applications can be added in just two clicks, including a preview to confirm suitability. This streamlines customization, especially for new or infrequent users, by offering AI-powered suggestions, application descriptions, and live KPIs for dynamic tiles. The experience is intuitive and efficient, ensuring that personalization aligns with users’ daily workflows.

Interested in experiencing these improvements first-hand? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

3.3. AI-assisted easy fill 

Also in beta, AI-assisted easy fill reimagines how form fields are completed. Instead of manually searching for and filling out fields, users can enter data via natural language. The system intelligently matches input to the correct fields and provides a clear overview before confirmation.

This innovation saves time, reduces navigation complexity, and increases accuracy in form completion. With automatic field matching and editable previews, easy fill offers a new level of convenience for maintaining business objects efficiently.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 delivers a powerful set of innovations that bridge insight and action with the support of generative AI. Whether it's optimizing financial processes, enhancing personalization, or improving sustainability reporting, these features demonstrate SAP’s commitment to building a truly intelligent cloud ERP system.

Interested in experiencing this enhanced feature? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

3.4. AI-assisted payment exception analysis

In the Manage Automatic Payments app (App ID: F0770), a new AI capability enhances the process of analyzing payment exceptions after a payment proposal run. This feature not only provides natural language explanations of payment exceptions but also highlights relevant log entries and suggests resolution actions.

This innovation reduces the time spent investigating and resolving issues in payment proposals. By guiding users directly to the root cause and recommended next steps, the process becomes significantly more efficient—improving payment accuracy and minimizing delays in financial operations.

 

Explore Joule Base and AI-assisted Features for Free

With Joule Base Entitlement in the SAP Store, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers can consume all of our Joule features in 2508 release for free. 

We’re also pleased to share that three recently introduced AI-assisted user experience innovations—easy enterprise search, easy filter, and smart summarization—are now available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition at no additional cost. With SAP Cloud ERP Base AI Entitlement here, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers  can consume Easy Filter, Smart Summarization and Enterprise Search for free. To get started, simply accept the SAP AI Terms. Once completed, we’ll reach out to enable these capabilities on your tenants, so you can immediately begin benefiting from more intuitive interactions, faster insights, and enhanced productivity

 

Explore everything about Artificial Intelligence in SAP Cloud ERP here.

entry.title: Re: Headcount Story Report
entry.content: The Story Report tool within the SuccessFactors platform is not the best tool to analyze results over time. You may need a more advanced solution like Workforce Analytics or Datasphere to handle this level of data transformation. entry.title: Re: In class and characteristics how to maintain authoriz...
entry.content:
Hello @AbhijitGoswami 

You're right, the fields that were free-text in ECC Class/Characteristic Authorisation Group and the three Authorisations in CL/CT are not free-text in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. In Public Cloud, they serve as value-helps pulling from configuration entries.

How to maintain the values in S4 Public Cloud

Maintain them in SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC), not in a Fiori app or SM30.

CBC path: Configuration Activities → Cross-Application Components → Classification System

  • Define Authorisation Groups for Classes
  • Define Authorisation Groups for Characteristics

Create the code example "AAAA" and descriptions, activate/transport via CBC. After activation, the dropdowns in CL02/CT04 (GUI for HTML) will display those values. There’s no separate Fiori maintenance app for these groups in Public Cloud.

If you don’t have CBC access, ask your implementation/CBC admin to add the entries and move them to your tenant.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Reporting - Aggregated Columns Label Field Issue
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

I am writing this to raise a flag about an issue with the Reporting Tool in SAP SuccessFactors .  When field labels are used in Aggregated columns Filters, the Error getting Preview issue is raised and the Report doesn't produce any results. The Report works as expected when the same field with Name is used. For example, in my instance I want to filter a specific pay component, when pay component (label) field is used, The Error getting preview issue is thrown and the report does not produce any results. When Pay Component (Name) field is used in the filter, it works as expected.

Requesting the Reporting Team to work on this and provide with a fix to have consistent behavior with all the fields when used in the filters.

entry.title: Re: Geospatial Service Definition Configuration of SAP Se...
entry.content:
Hi @rafael_umeda 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Following up on your question regarding the Geospatial Service Definition setup in SAP Service and Asset Manager, here are some facts you should know.

You only need to configure one Feature Service path. Be aware that a Feature Service can contain multiple layers, each with its own layer ID. In SSAM, you have the possibility to map technical objects to these different layer IDs using the Object ID Mapping Info. If a technical object needs multiple layers, my advice is to create separate object type assignments pointing to the same service but with different layer IDs.

Please note that the HTTP RFC destination is required for both online and offline maps. For online mode, it fetches data directly from GIS. For offline mode, it enables downloading and syncing feature data to the mobile client.

To summarise, ensure to configure one Feature Service and map multiple layers via layer Ids. Your RFC destination must be maintained for both online and offline scenarios.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

SAP Note 2916240 SSAM GIS integration setup details

entry.title: what is the cost for Basic TM and Advance TM . is this based on no of users or version
Steps to Configure AIF for Complex Structure File Data with Multiple Header-Item in Flat File
entry.content:
Introduction:

In modern enterprise integration scenarios, organizations often exchange file-based data that includes multiple layers of structured information—typically comprising header records and their associated item records. Accurately processing these complex file formats is vital to ensure seamless and reliable data exchange between systems.

SAP’s Application Integration Framework (AIF) offers a comprehensive solution for managing such integrations. It supports the definition and handling of complex data structures, including nested models where each header can be linked to multiple item records. This capability enables flexible interface design and robust data validation, making AIF an ideal choice for processing structured file content in SAP environments.

By utilizing AIF’s features, organizations can streamline file-based integrations and enhance data consistency across systems.

Problem Description

In enterprise integrations, companies often receive files from external systems that contain structured data—like sales orders with headers and related item details. These files can be complex, with multiple layers of information that need to be grouped and processed correctly.

Standard file processing in SAP can struggle with this kind of nested data. Common issues include:

  • Difficulty linking items to the correct headers
  • Risk of data mismatches
  • Complicated custom code for parsing and validation
  • Limited tools for tracking and fixing errors

SAP Application Integration Framework (AIF) helps solve these problems by supporting complex data structures. It allows headers to be connected to multiple items and provides tools for parsing, validating, and monitoring the data. However, setting up AIF for this requires careful planning and configuration to ensure everything works smoothly.

How does it work?

You need to perform the following steps to create an inbound file interface:

  1. Create the RAW structures for the interface
  2. Develop the interface
  3. Configure the file adapter settings for your interface
  4. Upload File
  5. Check Monitoring and Error Handling transaction

The following example will describe step-by-step how to Configure AIF for Complex File Data with Multiple Header-Item in Flat File

Simple example of a Sales Order creation in SAP, showing how the Header, Item, and Schedule Line levels are organized

Prepare the Flat File (CSV Format)

Create a .csv file using a pipe (|) as the delimiter. Here's a simple structure:

In order to execute this example, we require a file containing some test data and corresponding structures.

Explanation:

  • HEAD = Header line (Sales Order Number, Date, Customer, Sales Org, Currency)
  • ITEM = Item line (Item Number, Material, Material Description, Quantity, Price)
  • SCHD = Schedule line (Item Number, Schedule Line Item, Delivery Date, Quantity)

1. Create Raw Structures for the interface

🔧 Step 1: Create DDIC Structures

1.1 Header Structure – YAIF_ORDER_HDR

Field Name

Data Element

Description

ORDER_NO

VBELN

Sales Order Number

ORDER_DATE

AUDAT

Document Date

CUSTOMER_ID

KUNNR

Customer Number

VKORG

VKORG

Sales Organization

CURRENCY

WAERS

Currency

1.2 Item Structure – YAIF_ORDER_ITEM

Field Name

Data Element

Description

ITEM_NO

POSNR

Item Number

MATNR

MATNR

Material Number

MAKTX

MAKTX

Material Description

MENGE

MENGE_D

Quantity

AMOUNT

NETPR

Price

1.3 Schedule Line Structure – YAIF_ORDER_SCHEDULE_LINE

Field Name

Data Element

Description

POSNR

POSNR

Item Number

ETENR

ETENR

Schedule Line Number

DELIVERY_DATE

EDATU

Delivery Date

BMENG

BMENG

Delivery Quantity

 

📦 Step 2: Create Table Types

2.1 Item Table Type – YAIF_ORDER_ITEM_TT

  • Line Type: YAIF_ORDER_ITEM

2.2 Schedule Line Table Type – YAIF_ORDER_SCHEDULE_LINE_TT

  • Line Type: YAIF_ORDER_SCHEDULE_LINE

 🧩 Step 3: Create Composite Structure

3.1 Detail Structure – YAIF_ORDER_DTL

Field Name

Type

Description

HEADER

YAIF_ORDER_HDR

Header Structure

ITEM

YAIF_ORDER_ITEM_TT

Table of Items

SCHEDULE_LINE

YAIF_ORDER_SCHEDULE_LINE_TT

Table of Schedule Lines

3.2 Table Type – YAIF_ORDER_DTL_TT

  • Line Type: YAIF_ORDER_DTL

3.3 RAW Structure – YAIF_ORDER_DTL_S

Create the RAW structure for the interface. The structure contains only one component named

  • Component Name: ORDER
  • Component Type: YAIF_ORDER_DTL_TT

 2. Develop the interface

🚀 Step 4: Configure AIF Interface

4.1 Define Namespace

  • Use transaction /AIF/CUST

Click->Define namespace (e.g. YSALE)

4.2 Define Interfaces

Click->Define Interface

 

4.3 Specify Interface Engines    

  • Assign the SAP Application Engine

Click->Additional Interface Properties->Specify Interface Engines

4.4 Assign Source Structure Line

Click->Define Structure Mappings

4.4.2 Assign Destination Structure

Select source structure line->Click->Assign Destination Sturcture

4.4.3 Assign Actions

  • Create an action (e.g. SALE_CREATE)

Click->Assign Action

Click Enter on Action to create the action is action is not created

Click->Define Function ( To assign Function Module )

Double-click to create the Function Module that processes the data if not created

Navigate into the new function module by double clicking the name. In the function module call the follow up processing by inserting the coding displayed below:

 

*// Sample Logic
 CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_CUSTOMER_CREATE
  EXPORTING
    customer_data = CURR-HEADER
    customer_item = CURR-ITEM
    schedule_line = CURR-SCHEDULE_LINE
  TABLES
    return = return_tab.

 

Save and activate the function module.

3. Configure the file adapter settings for your interface

Click-> System Configuration->Configure File Adapter

  • File Type (ASC or BINARY)
  • File Content (Flat Structure, Complex Structure, XML, USER, XSLX )
  • Text Type (Fix char, Special Character Separator)
  • Offset Type Det Val (To Identify the record type from where it will start i.e HEAD, ITEM, SCHD line Details to prepare the data structure dynamically)
  • Length Type Det Val (Length of identity record type in i.e in our case first 4 character of new line)
  • Del Deter Val (True means ignore 1st Field separator immediately after the Det Value)

Leading Type (If we mark the record type as 'true', it means a new record will start from the file)

4. Upload File

The final step is to select and upload the file. The AIF File Upload can be found in the SAP Menu under SAP Menu -> Cross-Application Components --> SAP Application Interface Framework --> File Upload (or directly via transaction /AIF/LFA_UPLOAD_FILE).

Select your File Adapter Configuration (Config. Namespace and Config ID created in step 3). In section Upload from select the path where your file is stored.

Press executes.

5. Check Monitoring and Error Handling transaction

You will be forwarded to a log view where the log messages which have occurred during upload through below T-Code.

  • T-Code : /AIF/ERR ,  /AIF/IFMON

entry.title: Re: Open/close periods issues: I am unable to close my pe...
entry.content:
Hi @Ozdurand 

Thanks for sharing the screenshots. From what I see, you’re trying to set the MM period closing to October 2025 but your system is rejecting it because the period control record in table T001B for company code TUB1 is inconsistent with the date you are trying to close. You do have the possibility to fix that issue without using OMSY and here is how:

First, verify your current period in T001B

Then ensure your FI periods are open in OB52 for the next period which is 10/2025.

Thereafter, run MMPV with the correct next open period 10/2025 if your T001B shows 09/2025.

If the wrong period is already closed or opened, I advice you make use of MMRV to reset. However, be cautious when doing that.

If your T001B already shows 10/2025 but still blocks, Basis may be required to repair the record.

 

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Make it editable for object type S – Position in PP02.
entry.content:
Hello @abousap 

J'ai examiné le problème lié à l'infotype 9028 qui n'est pas modifiable pour le type d'objet S dans la transaction PP02. L'erreur 5A155 Infotype non autorisé apparaît car l'infotype n'est pas’ encore autorisé pour ce type d'objet.

Pour résoudre ce problème, voici les mesures que je vous conseille de prendre:

Autorisez l'infotype dans OOMT Ajoutez 9028 sous le type d'objet S.

Définissez la disponibilité dans OOIT. Définissez 9028 comme modifiable pour le type d'objet S.

Vérifiez les groupes d'infotypes OOGQ et les rôles. Assurez-vous que 9028 est attribué et que les rôles utilisateur contiennent les autorisations nécessaires.

Veuillez noter qu'une fois ces configurations effectuées, l'infotype 9028 sera modifiable pour les postes dans PP02.

J'espère que ces informations vous seront utiles. Je reste à votre disposition si vous avez d'autres questions.

Cordialement,

Chris

Take a few minutes to update your supplier account settings to receive relevant communications, tailor lead notifications, and enable AI features.

Log in and update your account today!

entry.title: Re: Getting 404 error while deploying migrated project fr...
entry.content:
Hi @rskumarv80 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

The 404 error with deployment and the messages about folders having children and MIME object deletion failing usually occur due to residual files or folders from previous deployments not being cleaned up properly.

When you are migrating from SAP Web IDE to Business Application Studio it is recommended to follow this approach:

First, ensure you export your project from Web IDE as a ZIP file. Then unzip and import this project into BAS

Thereafter, you should initialize your project afresh using terminal commands like npm init and ui5 init in the BAS environment.

Then make use of the SAP migration tool prompt to migrate your project properly. Doing this ensures your project structure is correct and old unnecessary files like MIME objects or folders with children are cleaned.

Please note that before you deploy to the on-premise system, you must verify the project structure in BAS does not have leftover folders or files conflicting with deployment.

You should clean or manually delete any old artifacts from the on-prem system if they prevent overwriting during deployment.

Finally, if you have any residual files or folders from previous deployments, please note, manual cleanup in the ABAP system via transaction SE80 or report might be required to remove conflicting MIME objects or folders.

This should help you resolve the deployment error you are facing.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Production relevancy indicator is not editable in con...
entry.content:
Hello, 

On SAP help page you can find information about this indicator: 

Indicates that the item is relevant for production.

Items with this indicator are copied to the planned order and the system calculates dependent requirements for them. When the planned order is converted to a production order, the system automatically copies these items to the production order.

This item status indicator is used to control:

  • Subsequent processing in related application areas

  • Which items are selected in the BOM explosion

Whether you can set and remove this indicator, or whether the system makes an unchangeable setting, depends on the BOM usage you selected on the initial screen.
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f9ba73d1b8c543c2bd2ba1666271af86/5c859f7728024f37aef228e4ae9ed384.html?locale=en-US 
Please check your BOM usage.
Regards, 
Jagoda

entry.title: Custom Search Attributes in SAP B2B
entry.content:
Introduction

Custom search attributes feature in SAP B2B scenarios can be used to enhance the search experience for users and help them find exactly what they are looking for. These attributes can be tailored to the specific needs of B2B buyers and sellers, such as industry-specific product features, technical specifications, pricing options, and more. By allowing users to filter search results based on these custom attributes, businesses can provide a more personalized and efficient search experience. Additionally, custom search attributes can also be used to gather valuable data on customer preferences and behavior, which can be leveraged to further optimize the B2B buying and selling process.

 

High level Diagram for Custom Search in B2B Monitoring

 

Note that you can configure maximum of 10 custom search attributes for your B2B Messages per tenant. Also, Custom Search Attributes with multiple values is supported now and the maximum length is 1000 characters.

Let’s try to understand this with a use case for Outbound Transaction. Let’s say your Company sends IDOC Invoice D.01B message to Trading Partner. There are standard search attributes such as Sender Interchange Control Number, Sender Message Number, Receiver Interchange Control Number, Receiver Message Number etc.  With the configuration of Custom Search Attribute Invoice Number, you can easily find all the Invoice B2B Interchanges that you want by providing the Invoice Number in the filter in B2B Monitoring.

How to configure?

Custom Search Attributes can be maintained for both Inbound as well as Outbound Transactions.

Configure Custom Search Attributes in Configuration Manager in Trading Partner Management (TPM)

 

  1. Login into the SAP Integration Suite and navigate to Design > B2B Scenarios.

       2. Select the Configuration Manager tab and choose Create to create custom search attribute.

           (Note: Maximum of 10 custom search attributes can be created)

       3. Enter a meaningful name in the Name field and provide a description in the Description field.

       4. Choose Save. The custom search attribute has been created successfully.

       5. After creating custom search attributes, these attributes need to be assigned to the transactions for them to  reflect in B2B Monitor.

 

 

Add Custom Search Attributes to Inbound/Outbound Transactions in Trading Partner Agreement (TPA)

 

  1. Navigate to Design > B2B Scenarios.

       2. Select Agreements > B2B Scenarios.

       3. Select the transaction, navigate to Custom Search Attribute tab and choose Add.

 

       In the resulting Dialog, maintain the following fields:

 

Field

Description

Name

Select a value from the list of attributes that are created via Configuration Manager

Source Type

Select whether the source type is Parameter or XPATH

Source Value

Enter the source value for the name. If Source type is Parameter, then enter the parameter here. If the Source type is XPath, then enter the XPath of the source value.

Data Source

Select whether the data source should be Sender Interchange or receiver Interchange

 

        

 

 

 

In an IDOC message, the Custom Search Attribute Invoice Number is taken from BELNR segment which is IDOC Document Number. Custom Search Attribute for Invoice Number is taken from the XPath //E1EDK01/BELNR.

Just for reference, as depicted below in the highlighted area, you can see how the XPath is configured for fields with Qualifier.

 

 

 

If the Source Type is Parameter, the custom search attribute should be maintained in the Trading Partner Agreement (TPA) under Activity Parameters tab in B2B Scenarios.

 

 

  

Header and properties would be resolved during runtime.

Once the Custom Search Attributes are created and defined, they should be used in the necessary B2B transactions in an agreement. These attributes are then pushed into Partner directory once the Trading Partner Agreement (TPA) is activated.

 

B2B Monitor

 

The incoming payload consists of the search values in XPath format and when the payload is parsed, the values are read and displayed in the B2B monitor.

In B2B Monitoring, navigate to Monitor > B2B Scenarios > Adapt Filters and select your Custom Search Attribute e.g., Invoice Number.

Enter the Invoice Number for which you want to see the B2B Messages and you can see only those messages.

 

 

Summary

Custom Search Attributes is one of the important features in SAP B2B which allows you to search for interchanges based on the user-defined filters in the B2B Monitor section.

entry.title: Re: Help creating a Data Provider for Forms created in AD...
entry.content:
Hi @diego_valentino 

Thank you for your question.

With the 2508 release, ADT now allows creation of forms, but Data Providers are not created directly in ADT. Only released CDS-based Data Providers appear in the list, which explains why you cannot see anything in your system.

For it to be visible, you should consider the following:

You have to release them in your tenant then the Standard SAP Data Providers will show.

For custom ones, you must create a CDS view with the correct annotations and also release it.

Please note that currently official SAP documentation for Data Providers in ADT Forms is limited, but further guidance is expected in upcoming releases.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: What Buyers Want- A Look at 12 Months of Buyer Demand on SAP Business Network
entry.content:
Over the past year, thousands of buyers across SAP Business Network have been actively searching for new sources of supply. The data confirms that demand is strong, spanning many industries, and not showing any signs of slowing down.

We looked back at the past 12 months of SAP Business Network Discovery (SAP's business match making feature) activity, including:

  • Over 80,000 buyer searches conducted through the SAP Business Network
  • 36,000+ Discovery posts, which are sourcing events buyers opened to the network to find new suppliers

Behind every search and post is a business actively looking to connect with new suppliers. These numbers reflect real buyer demand, and you have the supply they need. There are billions of dollars in opportunity on the network, and you can share in it.

What kinds of products and services are buyers sourcing?

Discovery data shows that demand spans nearly every major industry, from manufacturing to healthcare to creative services. We’ve grouped the data in categories based on industry relevance and average deal size to show you some of the key areas of opportunity:

Core Goods & Manufacturing

A major driver of sourcing activity on the network, this category saw thousands of posts across industrial manufacturing, construction materials, tools, components, and raw materials — totaling over 4,900 buyer posts, with average deal sizes ranging from $100K to nearly $900K.

Healthcare & Life Sciences

Buyer demand spanned medical products, lab equipment, healthcare services, and pharmaceuticals — with over 4,300 posts and deal sizes frequently exceeding $1M.

Infrastructure, Energy & Environment

Public and private sector buyers posted nearly 4,700 sourcing events related to construction, energy, environmental services, and public infrastructure — many with multimillion-dollar average values.

Professional Services & Tech

From digital transformation to financial services, this category accounted for over 6,300 posts — including some of the highest-value sourcing events, with several categories averaging over $2M per opportunity.

Logistics, Office & Facilities

Operational categories like transportation, office supplies, and cleaning services saw steady buyer activity, with over 2,000 sourcing posts and average deal sizes ranging from $60K to $860K.

These are just highlights- there is even more buyer demand in many other industries not listed. But the data shows that buyers are searching every day across a wide variety of categories. And when they search, your profile is how you get discovered.

Keep Your Profile Working for You

If it’s been a while since you’ve updated your SAP Business Network supplier profile, now is the time. Here’s why:

  • Your profile is how buyers find you in search
  • It determines how you match to active Discovery posts
  • Updated profiles with complete, relevant information are more likely to generate qualified leads

Check out this profile checklist to make sure yours is in great shape.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to hide the goal category in a perform...
entry.content:
Hello Marion,

Yes, you can hide the Goal category field by adding the "control-category-element" in your goal plan XML.

The control-category-element is a field used in the goal plan template to manage permissions for category selection. It must be configured in the XML template. This attribute allows you to define write and read permissions for the Category field. 

If you want to hide the Category field, follow these steps.

  1. Add a "control-category-element" in the Goal Plan XML. 
  2. Do not define a read and write permission for  "control-category-element"

Please review this KBA, where the category field is not visible. Refer to the example configuration of the  "control-category-element". Do not add permission, so that it will be hidden.

3199182 

Thank you. 

Michael

entry.title: Standard Integration Packages Plug-and-Play for SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 and ESM and Utlities
entry.content:
In today's growing CRM demand faster, more agile implementations with minimal overhead. SAP understands this need and has responded with a new generation of standard integration packages for SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2, specially tailored for industries such as Utilities and Enterprise Service Management (ESM). These pre-packaged solutions are designed for plug-and-play integration, eliminating the need for extensive customization and ensuring rapid deployment and value realization.

Why Standard Integration Packages?

Traditionally, integration projects have required significant customization, consulting hours, and effort. This often led to increased costs, longer go-live timelines, and higher maintenance overhead. Standard integration packages reverse this model by offering:

  • Preconfigured scenarios
  • Best practice processes
  • Certified integration content
  • Zero or minimal customization requirements

These benefits help organizations streamline operations, reduce IT complexity, and accelerate time-to-value.

Key Features of the Standard Integration Packages

1. Out-of-the-Box Integration

SAP provides prebuilt connectors and iFlows using SAP Integration Suite (formerly CPI) to integrate SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 with ESM solutions (e.g., SAP S/4HANA Service) and utility backends (e.g., IS-U, S/4HANA Utilities).

2. Industry-Specific Scenarios

These packages cater specifically to industry needs:

  • Utilities: Handle meter-to-cash processes, service request handling, complaint management, and field service coordination.
  • ESM: Manage enterprise-wide service requests, knowledge bases, approvals, and fulfillment workflows.

3. Certified Integration Content

All integration content is:

  • Published in the SAP API Business Hub
  • Regularly updated and maintained by SAP
  • Based on SAP Best Practices and aligned with standard APIs
Standard Integration PackagesDescription of the Package contains
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration with SAP CPQ Quote integration between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP CPQ
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP ERPIntegrate sales processes between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP ERP.
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANAIntegrate sales processes between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionIntegrate sales processes between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP S/4HANAIntegrate master data between SAP Sales and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionIntegrate master data between SAP Sales and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
Qualtrics Integration with SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2Integration flow for integrating Qualtrics and SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP ERPIntegrate master data between SAP Sales and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP ERP
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration with SAP SuccessFactors Employee CentralEmployee replication from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2
Sales Cloud Version 2 - Customer Insights Integration with SAP S/4HANAIntegrated transactional data from SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud with Sales Cloud Version 2 - Customer Insights
SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration with SAP S/4HANAIntegration of service management processes between SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA (Service Management)
SAP Service Cloud V2 for Utilities Contract Account Integration with SAP S/4HANAThis package integrates Utilities Contract Account transactional data between SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA
SAP Service Cloud V2 for Utilities Master Data Integration with SAP S/4HANAThis package integrates Utilities master data between SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA.
SAP Enterprise Service Management Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud

This integration package enables integration between SAP Enterprise Service Management and SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Resources Available to Customers

Customers can access all relevant materials directly via:

  • 📘 SAP API Business Hub: Browse and explore integration packages, iFlows, and APIs
  • 🧰 SAP Best Practices Explorer : Implementation guides, configuration wizards, and sample data
  • 📦 SAP Integration Suite: Central platform to deploy and manage integrations

Conclusion

SAP’s standard integration packages for SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 with ESM and Utilities are a game-changer for businesses looking to simplify and speed up their digital transformation. With true plug-and-play functionality, these packages remove traditional barriers to integration and enable organizations to focus on delivering superior customer and service experiences — without the burden of custom development.

entry.title: Re: Cross Model Copy Data Action Different Hierarchy Levels
entry.content:
Hi @Abed 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

To avoid this budget explosion and keep budgets at the Job Family level in the operational model, there are few factors to consider.  You will need to:

First, adjust the cross-model copy mapping to respect the level hierarchy so that your budget data copies only to the Job Family level in the target model.

Then you have to avoid mapping Job Family in the tactical model directly to Job Role in the operational model without a proper aggregation or grouping.

Make sure you use formulas or data actions in SAP Analytics Cloud to control the copy logic and prevent spreading values across all detailed Job Roles.

Alternatively, you have the possibility to create a matching aggregation node or attribute that aligns Job Roles back to Job Families and use this in your data action to conditionally copy budget data only once per Job Family group in the operational model.

This means that you will need to build your cross-model copy with inclusion of aggregation or filtering steps to control how hierarchical budget values flow from tactical to operational levels without duplication.

I hope this provides the required insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP API Management - APIKey and Response Caching
entry.content:
@jay_san_nz thank you so much.
Caching is best suited for scenarios where data does not change frequently; if the data is updated very often, it may not be reliable. If caching is still required, you either keep the cache lifetime short or leverage backend headers such as Last-Modified or ETag for extra validation. When the client sends conditional headers like If-None-Match, the backend responds with 304 Not Modified if nothing has changed (so the cached response is used), or 200 OK with fresh data if it has, and the cache is updated. Alternatively, if POST or PATCH requests are made to the same GET service, these should be handled in a separate proxy flow to trigger cache invalidation.

entry.title: Re: What is the difference between SAP Fiori Launchpad vs...
entry.content:
@shwufang_loh  The main difference  between FLP and S/4HANA Home Page is that : 

SAP Fiori Launchpad (FLP) is the shell and entry point to all Fiori apps in your S/4HANA system. It provides navigation, search, notifications, roles, spaces, and pages where you will find all the Fiori Apps that you have Authorization to access.

While My Home is a personal start page inside the Launchpad. It shows your tasks, insights, and favorites to start the day quickly. Think about it like a daily landing page that you can customize as you want with your favorite or most-used Fiori Apps  
In terms of Context: 
Fiori Launchpad: Runs as the common UI shell for S/4HANA. Admins and key users structure content with roles, catalogs, spaces, and pages.
My Home: Lives within the Launchpad. It is the product home page for end users, focused on personalization and work prioritization.
In terms of the Business or user goal:
Fiori Launchpad: Help users find and launch the right apps, move between spaces, use enterprise search, and see notifications.
My Home: Help users act fast, by surfacing to-dos, situations, KPIs, and quick links to their most used apps and pages.

When to use which
Use Fiori Launchpad as the universal entry point for all users and all apps.
Set My Home as the default landing page for end users who need a single place for tasks, insights, and favorites.

Here are some useful sources if you would like to learn more : 
SAP Fiori Launchpad Home Page 

My Home in SAP S/4HANA


SAP S/4HANA Product Home Page – My Home 

I hope that could help 😊

entry.title: Re: Error in Fetching API through SAP UI5 - CORS Error -...
entry.content: Hi @Akash_Kanyadhara  i think  This is a CORS issue. The browser sends a preflight OPTIONS request for your PATCH with custom headers, and the API response does not include the required CORS headers. You cannot fix this in UI5 code alone. You must either enable CORS on the API or call it through a proxy on BTP.

entry.title: Re: IS NOT Null is not filtering the data for the null va...
entry.content:
Hi @kalyanbw99 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through a few options.

Please note, when you use the "IS NOT NULL" filter for a field, you may still see records with null or empty values due to how the system handles nulls. There are Reasons for this and they include the following:

Some empty values are stored as empty strings or placeholders and not true nulls.

The data model or backend query might treat nullability differently.

Filters may need to exclude both nulls and empty strings to fully remove empty data.

As a workaround, you have the possibility to create a calculated attribute to convert nulls to a specific value. This can help apply the filter more reliably.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
